Would it be possible to add Keyboard Shortcuts to show/hide the centers of mass/lift/thrust?

Creative method to do it. Good to know.

But there is a simpler way: By opening the editor extension debug window. There you can see all information about a part. Rotation, position both local and global, etc...

Say you want to adjust an antenna on top of a Stayputnik, center it with the 'V' and/or 'H' key then set the editor to rotate mode (press 3 by default) and set snap angle to disabled. Click on the antenna with the debug information window open and look at the different rotation values. Click and drag the rotate widget until you have what you want. Note that the farther away from the widget center you are (click and hold and move left or right toward the edge of the screen), the more precise the rotation becomes...

Hi folks,

Installed this into my 1.0.5 KSP today. Noticed strange behavior when I press "H" hotkey while hovering a new part over one of a group of symmetric mounted parts. Could someone double check for me to see if they can reproduce on their end?

1) Place orange tank (root part).
2) Radially mount 4 symmetric girders, pointing outwards.
3) Grab a new orange tank and hover it over one of the girder butts, as if you were going to mount it. Once it's in the correct spot, don't attach it, but instead press H.

On my end, some of the girders disappear. Here's a before/after:

[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/IMFcud6.png[/IMG]

If you grab the mounted girders and reattach, the missing members come back. Note I [I]may[/I] have switched between Mirror and Radial mode a couple times before starting this. Radial mode was active when I did it.

[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/Pl7f8NT.png[/IMG]

[B]Edit: [/B]Re-read the OP and realized this is probably intended behavior (the two "disappearing" girders actually got moved inside the tank). I guess H can produce some weird results with symmetric radial mounted parts :-) Edited November 22, 2015 by Fwiffo

[B]Fwiffo[/B]: I believe you want to push the key [i]after[/i] attaching the tanks, not before. I know V works only with attached parts. I suspect your are causing the girders to snap to the center of the core tank.

[edit]And I'm slow to read the whole post. Still, I guess a second opinion doesn't hurt.

Thanks taniwha and sorry for the false alarm.

Something else I noticed: I [I]think [/I]this mod might be causing KSP to hang when you go to the VAB after using the Database | "Reload All" option from the ALT+F12 debug menu. Noticed it happening while trying to reload my UbioZur welded parts. Haven't investigated further yet. I realize that's a dangerous option, but it's a handy dangerous one and (surprisingly) most of my other mods aren't causing catastrophic effects from it (although GCmonitor is getting duplicated).

Edit: I may have jumped the gun on this one too. Will let you know if / when I can reliably reproduce it. Edited November 23, 2015 by Fwiffo

[B]Fwiffo[/B]: Hmm, I don't see why EE would cause a hang, but...

In any case, I would suggest that UbioZur needs to come up with a way of getting parts into the list without doing a reload, though I'm sure such will be fraught with much hair-pulling. Though it's not like I didn't pull a lot of hair getting EL to work :).
